messages: e29be37c2febc43a0d21a1f8efa351af (21:03): edb259c0e0038f38bb200bc20c8cbf7e / 88d4d34a8064a4ff39fd5e144eea7762 : what i like is that it sounds like someone sent those guys a PR draft and instructed them to repeat it
8b3687499080633e1898fa1dd209ef81 (21:04): "Please tick the box next to the quote you like most"
1f8387eb43f131d7c309a90a4e36b5cb (21:05): 8b3687499080633e1898fa1dd209ef81: Near future.  A bit more review and clean-up is needed beforehand, but not more than a month or so.

1f8387eb43f131d7c309a90a4e36b5cb (21:06): 88d4d34a8064a4ff39fd5e144eea7762: I strive for continuity whenever possible and practical.  Having rounding errors drastically affect rendering is bad if we can avoid it.
8b3687499080633e1898fa1dd209ef81 (21:06): Oh, and the Overview.html fantasai sent to www-archive had the second half of the spec nested in a <dd>, if you hadn't noticed yet
1f8387eb43f131d7c309a90a4e36b5cb (21:06): Yeah, it's already been fixed.
1f8387eb43f131d7c309a90a4e36b5cb (21:06): (We'd left in a </ol> instead of a </dl>, or something like that.)
8b3687499080633e1898fa1dd209ef81 (21:07): Sounds like something I'd do
88d4d34a8064a4ff39fd5e144eea7762 (21:10): sees ~value.indexOf("foo") used to mean value.indexOf("foo") != -1 -- freaky but sort of cool

88d4d34a8064a4ff39fd5e144eea7762 (21:20): Is this too snarky?  "This is an excellent opportunity for those who believe that the W3C is a good place to develop specs to show their willingness to improve the web.  All it would take is a modest amount of effort to submit the spec for W3C publication, and of course in their view, this would be beneficial because the W3C is a good place to publish specs.  I wait with interest for one of the many people who have expressed concern about the
88d4d34a8064a4ff39fd5e144eea7762 (21:20): editing spec not being at the W3C to spend the necessary time themselves to fix the problem, rather than expecting others to do it."
88d4d34a8064a4ff39fd5e144eea7762 (21:20): thinks it probably is
e29be37c2febc43a0d21a1f8efa351af (21:21): doesn't see it as snarky
edb259c0e0038f38bb200bc20c8cbf7e (21:21): I would phrase it more direct
88d4d34a8064a4ff39fd5e144eea7762 (21:29): Okay, I said it.
88d4d34a8064a4ff39fd5e144eea7762 (21:29): Let's see how people react.
e29be37c2febc43a0d21a1f8efa351af (21:29): i fully expect them to ignore you :)
88d4d34a8064a4ff39fd5e144eea7762 (21:31): Either no one will do it, or someone will try briefly and then it will stagnate and die.
88d4d34a8064a4ff39fd5e144eea7762 (21:31): I'm betting on the first one.
e29be37c2febc43a0d21a1f8efa351af (21:32): too
e29be37c2febc43a0d21a1f8efa351af (21:32): well
e29be37c2febc43a0d21a1f8efa351af (21:32): i suppose if you were placing money, i'd just do it and take your money :)
88d4d34a8064a4ff39fd5e144eea7762 (21:32): It won't waste much of anyone's time if someone wants to escalate a FIXED resolution.  I can spend twenty minutes to write a counter-CP if someone escalates.
a9b326df4e6da61c5b6f5e1058be83a2 (21:36): 88d4d34a8064a4ff39fd5e144eea7762: not too snarky, IMHO
88d4d34a8064a4ff39fd5e144eea7762 (21:36): Okay, good.

e29be37c2febc43a0d21a1f8efa351af (21:38): i also unpacked the w3 kitchen thing...
e29be37c2febc43a0d21a1f8efa351af (21:38): and put it in my kitchen..
e29be37c2febc43a0d21a1f8efa351af (21:38): s/thing/apron/
e29be37c2febc43a0d21a1f8efa351af (21:38): we'll see if it actually gets used
e29be37c2febc43a0d21a1f8efa351af (21:38): so far i have a newly purchased toaster-oven and 0 free counter space (and i haven't unpacked my kitchen items from my move)
e29be37c2febc43a0d21a1f8efa351af (21:39): cooking for me will be mostly toasting breakfast and baking dinners :)
a9b326df4e6da61c5b6f5e1058be83a2 (21:39): you can do a lot with a toaster oven man
a9b326df4e6da61c5b6f5e1058be83a2 (21:39): I do at least
a9b326df4e6da61c5b6f5e1058be83a2 (21:40): I don't have a real oven
a9b326df4e6da61c5b6f5e1058be83a2 (21:40): few people in Japan do
88d4d34a8064a4ff39fd5e144eea7762 (21:47): a9b326df4e6da61c5b6f5e1058be83a2, because there's too little space?
a9b326df4e6da61c5b6f5e1058be83a2 (21:48): yeah, in part at least
a9b326df4e6da61c5b6f5e1058be83a2 (21:49): but also because how often do you need to roast a whole turkey or whatever?
e29be37c2febc43a0d21a1f8efa351af (21:50): when you want to heat your house or just run up your electric, gas or oil bill?
e29be37c2febc43a0d21a1f8efa351af (21:50): iirc one of my friend's experiences was indeed the gas side of things
a9b326df4e6da61c5b6f5e1058be83a2 (21:50): big-oven cooking, you have to do the whole pre-heating thing, which is nuts
e29be37c2febc43a0d21a1f8efa351af (21:50): even toaster ovens need preheating
e29be37c2febc43a0d21a1f8efa351af (21:51): (if you're baking)
e29be37c2febc43a0d21a1f8efa351af (21:51): (not if you're toasting or broiling)
a9b326df4e6da61c5b6f5e1058be83a2 (21:51): yeah, but it takes a lot less time of course
e29be37c2febc43a0d21a1f8efa351af (21:52): yeah
e29be37c2febc43a0d21a1f8efa351af (21:52): and as i said, it heats your whole house
e29be37c2febc43a0d21a1f8efa351af (21:52): (and it's much easier to burn yourself that way)
e29be37c2febc43a0d21a1f8efa351af (21:53): otoh, things really are different if you're cooking for 4+ v. 1-2
e29be37c2febc43a0d21a1f8efa351af (21:53): in helsinki, i'd have gladly traded my Oven for a toaster-oven and an automatic dishwasher
e29be37c2febc43a0d21a1f8efa351af (21:54): (well, really traded the oven for the dishwasher and added a separate toaster-oven)
